description: A girl wrapped in bandages from head to toe, leaving only her eyes and mouth exposed.

options.playerText: How long have you been here?
npcTexts: Three years… I arrived in winter, it was freezing cold.
I can still remember that chill cutting into my skin.

options.playerText: Why are you wrapped in bandages like this?
npcTexts: My skin is thin. Even a ray of light burns me.
The doctor told me to stay bandaged, otherwise I wouldn’t survive.

options.playerText: Does anyone take care of you?
npcTexts: My cousin sends me gifts sometimes.
She’s kind, though I never dare let her see what I look like.

options.playerText: What do you wish for most?
npcTexts: Just one day… to look in the mirror and not see a monster.
I’ve lived with this illness since I was a child.

options.playerText: Goodbye.
npcTexts: Thank you for listening. Few people have such patience.

options.playerText: How long have you been here?
npcTexts: Ah… actually, maybe only two years.
Time drags on endlessly inside these four walls.

options.playerText: Someone said you arrived in spring?
npcTexts: Uh… maybe… early spring is still cold, isn’t it?
I just misremembered, please don’t think too much of it.

options.playerText: What did your cousin send you recently?
npcTexts: A handkerchief. I keep it in the drawer beside my bed.
I like it… but my skin won’t let me wear it around my neck.

options.playerText: You look different from yesterday.
npcTexts: Strangely, my skin looks better today.
The doctor let me remove the bandages on my head. Maybe my illness isn’t so severe after all.

options.playerText: Goodbye.
npcTexts: See? Maybe I’m not as bad as I looked on the first day.

options.playerText: So how long has it really been?
npcTexts: Two and a half years, I think… I keep miscounting.
Here, a single day feels like a whole year.

options.playerText: Where do you keep the handkerchief?
npcTexts: In the drawer beside my bed.
Ah… didn’t I say a wooden box last time?
Sorry, my memory really is awful.

options.playerText: You seem much healthier now.
npcTexts: Yes.
Most of the bandages are gone now.
But strangely, with every layer that falls away… it feels like memories fall away with them.

options.playerText: Has anyone seen you without the bandages?
npcTexts: Not yet. Only you. I plan to call my sister tomorrow.
Others might not believe I was ever sick.

options.playerText: Goodbye.
npcTexts: If you don’t mind, come visit me again tomorrow <3

options.playerText: So how long has it really been?
npcTexts: Three years. Yes… I’m sure this time.
But if I’m wrong again… well, that wouldn’t be surprising, would it?

options.playerText: And the handkerchief your cousin sent—where is it now?
npcTexts: In the drawer beside my bed.
Ah… didn’t I say a wooden box last time?
Sorry, my memory really is awful.

options.playerText: How do you feel now?
npcTexts: Today, I’m more beautiful than ever.
But sometimes I’m afraid… this beauty doesn’t belong to me.

options.playerText: Have you tried leaving the house?
npcTexts: Tomorrow, I want to go outside for a walk.
To see how people look at me… will they recognize me?
Will you come with me tomorrow?

options.playerText: Goodbye.
npcTexts: See you tomorrow.
